Row.Text: I never thought I would see the end so soon!
You are nothing but a glorified barbarian. Cruel, and ruthless.
I have lived long enough to know when I am defeated. Carry on.
Egypt is lost. If I can't embrace my love, I will embrace the asps.
We were the august and glorious… but no, never mind that. You are victorious. May your reign be more peaceful than mine ever was.
You can chain me, you can torture me, you can even destroy this body, but you will never imprison my mind.
What treachery did this to me? No, what evil?
Ares has abandoned us. Sparta is defeated.
So, I will join the einherjar in Valhalla and feast, while you toil away here.
Please end this dishonor to my family… to my people.
May God grant me these last wishes—peace and prosperity for Brazil.
You may have defeated us, but what we leave behind is woven into the lives of others.
I am defeated. To live one’s life is not like crossing a field.
My lands… my Kingdom… why, God? Why have you forsaken me?
I never thought this could happen… not like this.
This is not victory. “Victory” is changing the hearts of your opponents; through gentleness, through kindness.
Congratulations. Instead of the United States of America, your nation will go far.
The Empress falls, but I will be remembered. Will you?
The wellbeing of the defeated is to not hope for much more wellbeing.
This severe and afflicting loss will not be sustained, and England, thank providence, will ascend again.
I never thought I would see the end so soon!
You are nothing but a glorified barbarian. Cruel, and ruthless.
I have lived long enough to know when I am defeated. Carry on.
Egypt is lost. If I can't embrace my love, I will embrace the asps.
We were the august and glorious… but no, never mind that. You are victorious. May your reign be more peaceful than mine ever was.
You can chain me, you can torture me, you can even destroy this body, but you will never imprison my mind.
What treachery did this to me? No, what evil?
Ares has abandoned us. Sparta is defeated.
So, I will join the einherjar in Valhalla and feast, while you toil away here.
Please end this dishonor to my family… to my people.
Huitzilopochtli forgive our weakness… my weakness. I was not strong enough to serve you.
May God grant me these last wishes—peace and prosperity for Brazil.
You may have defeated us, but what we leave behind is woven into the lives of others.
I am defeated. To live one’s life is not like crossing a field.
My lands… my Kingdom… why, God? Why have you forsaken me?
I never thought this could happen… not like this.
This is not victory. “Victory” is changing the hearts of your opponents; through gentleness, through kindness.
Congratulations. Instead of the United States of America, your nation will go far.
The Empress falls, but I will be remembered. Will you?
The wellbeing of the defeated is to not hope for much more wellbeing.
This severe and afflicting loss will not be sustained, and England, thank providence, will ascend again.
